content: And when that happens, the historical paradigm has been uncapped CPI escalators in almost all the countries, excluding the U.S. and the U.K. And so what happens then is our perspective is that inflation has been low for a long period of time in the past, they got the benefit about over 10, 20 years historically, and now going forward, it may actually be -- it may increase because of the environment we're living in.
